com.st.st25sdk

Interface RFReaderInterface


  • public interface RFReaderInterface
    This interface describes all the methods required by the SDK to access a tag through a NFC Reader

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RFReaderInterface.InventoryMode
      Lists all supported inventory modes
      static class  RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode
      Lists all possible transceive modes

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      NFCTag.NfcTagTypes decodeTagType(byte[] uid)
      decodeTagType must return the type of the tag specified by the given uid + set the reader in the proper mode of operation for this tag
      byte[] getLastTransceivedData()
      Provides the last command run when the transceive mode was set to RECORD If no command was recorded, returns an empty byte array (new byte[] {})
      int getMaxReceiveLengthInBytes()
      Gets the maximum number of bytes that the RF reader can receive in one command
      int getMaxTransmitLengthInBytes()
      Gets the maximum number of bytes that the RF reader can transmit in one command
      java.lang.String[] getTechList(byte[] uid)
      Getter for a tag technology list
      java.util.List<byte[]> getTransceivedData()
      Provides the commands run since the transceive mode was set to RECORD
      RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode getTransceiveMode()
      Returns the current TransceiveMode
      java.util.List<byte[]> inventory(RFReaderInterface.InventoryMode mode)
      Returns a list of detected tags.
      byte iso14443aDeSelectTag(byte[] uid)
      Deselects a ISO14443-A tag specified by its uid
      byte iso14443aSelectTag(byte[] uid)
      Selects a ISO14443-A tag specified by its uid
      byte iso14443bDeSelectTag(byte[] pupi)
      Deselects a ISO14443-B tag specified by its pupi
      byte iso14443bSelectTag(byte[] pupi)
      Selects a ISO14443-B tag specified by its pupi
      void setTagResponseLengthInBytes(int responseDataLengthInBytes)
      Sets the size in bytes of the RF frame expected from the tag.
      void setTransceiveMode(RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode mode)
      Sets transceive to the specified mode
      byte[] transceive(java.lang.Object obj, java.lang.String commandName, byte[] data)
      Sends a command to the RF reader, and get the tag's response

    • Method Detail

      • transceive

        byte[] transceive(java.lang.Object obj,
                  java.lang.String commandName,
                  byte[] data)
           throws STException
        Sends a command to the RF reader, and get the tag's response
        Parameters:
        obj - object shared between the application and the reader implementation
        commandName - commandName
        data - data to transceive
        Returns:
        the tag's response
        Throws:
        STException - When the reader is in EVAL mode, the transceive() method must throw a TRANSCEIVE_EVAL_MODE STException along with the frame associated to the command

      • setTransceiveMode

        void setTransceiveMode(RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode mode)
        Sets transceive to the specified mode
        Parameters:
        mode - The Transceive mode - NORMAL: Send RF command and returns data from tag - EVAL: the transceive command will throw a TRANSCEIVE_EVAL_MODE STException and set data corresponding to the frame sent by the reader - RECORD: the transceive command will be executed and the data corresponding to the frame sent by the reader is saved

      • getTransceivedData

        java.util.List<byte[]> getTransceivedData()
        Provides the commands run since the transceive mode was set to RECORD
        Returns:
        the list of commands that have been sent since the was set to RECORD

      • getLastTransceivedData

        byte[] getLastTransceivedData()
        Provides the last command run when the transceive mode was set to RECORD If no command was recorded, returns an empty byte array (new byte[] {})
        Returns:
        the last command run when the transceive mode was set to RECORD

      • getTransceiveMode

        RFReaderInterface.TransceiveMode getTransceiveMode()
        Returns the current TransceiveMode
        Returns:
        current reader's transceive mode

      • decodeTagType

        NFCTag.NfcTagTypes decodeTagType(byte[] uid)
                          throws STException
        decodeTagType must return the type of the tag specified by the given uid + set the reader in the proper mode of operation for this tag
        Parameters:
        uid - tag's UID
        Returns:
        type of NFC tag
        Throws:
        STException - INVALID_DATA if the type of the tag cannot be assessed

      • getTechList

        java.lang.String[] getTechList(byte[] uid)
        Getter for a tag technology list
        Parameters:
        uid - tag's UID
        Returns:
        the tag's technology list

      • getMaxTransmitLengthInBytes

        int getMaxTransmitLengthInBytes()
        Gets the maximum number of bytes that the RF reader can transmit in one command
        Returns:
        the maximum number of bytes that the RF reader can transmit in one command

      • getMaxReceiveLengthInBytes

        int getMaxReceiveLengthInBytes()
        Gets the maximum number of bytes that the RF reader can receive in one command
        Returns:
        the maximum number of bytes that the RF reader can receive in one command

      • setTagResponseLengthInBytes

        void setTagResponseLengthInBytes(int responseDataLengthInBytes)
        Sets the size in bytes of the RF frame expected from the tag. This value is needed for some readers on specific commands. Once the RF command is sent, this length value will be reset to zero.
        Parameters:
        responseDataLengthInBytes - size of the response expected from the tag

      • inventory

        java.util.List<byte[]> inventory(RFReaderInterface.InventoryMode mode)
                          throws STException
        Returns a list of detected tags. Each byte array in the list is in the LSByte-first order. Example: element {0xF0, 0xC8, 0xD6, 0x01, 0x04, 0x26, 0x02, 0xE0} for UID = E002260401D6C8F0
        Parameters:
        mode - allows the reader to switch between different ISO/NFC standards such as NFC Type 4 or NFC Type 5
        Returns:
        List of current detected tag UIDs
        Throws:
        STException

      • iso14443aSelectTag

        byte iso14443aSelectTag(byte[] uid)
                 throws STException
        Selects a ISO14443-A tag specified by its uid
        Parameters:
        uid - ISO14443-A tag's UID
        Returns:
        0 if success
        Throws:
        STException

      • iso14443aDeSelectTag

        byte iso14443aDeSelectTag(byte[] uid)
                   throws STException
        Deselects a ISO14443-A tag specified by its uid
        Parameters:
        uid - ISO14443-A tag's UID
        Returns:
        0 if success
        Throws:
        STException

        byte iso14443bSelectTag(byte[] pupi)
                 throws STException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        0 if success
        Throws:
        STException

        Parameters:
